p: For the period 1970–2009, the average annual rate of increase of the Baja California population was calculated to be 0.99 ( Table 2). The multiplicative factor M at this λ value is 4.31 (95% CI: 3.59–5.02) [ 18], and hence the population size in 2009 was estimated to be n = 22,300 individuals (95% CI: 18,575–25,974).
